author: jacopoc
msg: Since ServiceEcaSetField are cached, if a seca definition contains a set operation with an env-name like:
then the expanded value (at the time of creation) is stored in the ServiceEcaSetField and then reused even when the seca is re-executed with a different context.
This commit fix the bug by removing the outer if statement "if (UtilValidate.isEmpty(this.value))".
Thanks to Deepak Dixit for spotting this issue.

author: desruisseaux
msg: Renamed DefaultMetadata.getDates() as getDateInfo() for compliance with ISO 19115:2014 identifier name, which is "dateInfo".

author: hanya
msg: #i125991# catch IndexOutOfBoundsException to avoid fatal error happen when input method is used on Gtk environment
